WorkItem.Description: Application crash using latin character on the body of the email
WorkItem.Summary: Application crash using latin character on the body of the email

Comments.Message:
Hi Edwinet

Thanks for reporting this issue. I have replicated this problem and am now working on a fix.

Note that the problem only occurs if the client sends 8bit data without making use of the 8BITMIME extension BODY=8BITMIME parameter to the MAIL FROM command. Unless the client sends this parameter smtp4dev deliberately enforces the 7bit ASCII only transport defined by the SMTP RFCs and will deliberately zero the 8th bit of all message data (This results in the message appearing to be corrupted).

Thanks
Rob

Just to be clear on previous point. If client is sending 8 bit data without using 8BITMIME extension then this is probably a bug in your mail client program. Generally client program should either use 8BITMIME or encode the message with a content-transfer-encoding such as quoted-printable.
